NewsDetail.Name: Mirari Brass Quintet May 15
NewsDetail.Title: Mirari Brass Quartet
NewsDetail.Abstract: Playing trumpet, horn, trombone and tuba, they strive to elevate brass repertoire to new heights by celebrating contemporary chamber music, actively commissioning new works and demonstrating a high level of musical sensitivity in standard repertoire.
NewsDetail.Author: missing value
NewsDetail.BodyCopy:
Tuesday, May 15, 7:30 p.m., Barrus Concert Hall

www.miraribrass.com

The Mirari Brass Quintet is comprised of brass innovators with a wide variety of backgrounds. Playing trumpet, horn, trombone and tuba, they strive to elevate brass repertoire to new heights by celebrating contemporary chamber music, actively commissioning new works and demonstrating a high level of musical sensitivity in standard repertoire. Being fluent in all styles of music from classical to jazz, their performances are programmed to be accessible to a wide audience, while opening listeners' imaginations to a world of possibility. It's not uncommon for lines separating genres to be blurred and reshaped during a Mirari Brass Quintet performance. They always seek to inspire and to be inspired. RATING: Classical to jazz

Tickets go on sale April 23. Cost is $8 for general public, $4 for BYU-Idaho students. No children under six. Event dress. To purchase tickets online, click here: tickets.byui.edu
